result.title: Data Management and System Failure Management Plan v2
result.description: To ensure system failure management as well as ethical requirements during the project, the task will include a Data Management and System Failure Management Plan in M6 and M24 in compliance with EC rules. This plan will cover the handling of data during and after the project lifetime, the rules for collecting, processing, using and generating data and the standards to be applied; and will state the base for partners’ participation in the “Pilot on Open Research Data in Horizon 2020”.

result.title: Evaluation and Validation Report of the Pilots
result.description: T6.7 will ensure that all relevant data from the pilots will be collected and analysed properly, ensuring data availability, compliance to GDPR and quality, and taking measures to mitigate possible problems during the demonstration regarding missing data. A final Pilot Evaluation and Validation Report will be prepared by EDP and made publicly available.

result.title: Progress Reports v2
result.description: Outcome of T9.2, ongoing for the entire duration of the project and assumes full control of all financial and administrative aspects of the project. These will be prepared internally by the WP Leaders in order to let the PC have a better view and control of the activities’ progress.

result.title: Report for policymakers with strategies for sustainable craft ecosystem management and heritage preservation
result.description: Presentation of the analysis of the historical changes of the role of crafts, and their relations with other sectors in the selected ecosystems. Suggestions of how to support selected traditional and authentic crafts at risk of disappearing.Deliverable (includes Policy Brief) is due on Month 12 and then updated continuously and finalised in the last month of the project.

result.title: Periodic Digital Dissemination Activities Report v2
result.description: The foreseen web-based communication channels, according to the dissemination plan from T8.1, will be active during the whole project’s lifetime, reporting any advances within a dedicated report at a periodic consolidated basis while being populated and supported by the visual and multimedia material developed in T8.2. A coherent and aggressive dissemination strategy will be designed for the web and social networks (see T8.1), accompanied by the high outreach potential given by the social media platforms presence such as LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube issued early in the project while maintained and evaluated periodically until its completion. Moreover, project newsletters and web-press releases; with news and info project activities, events and available outcomes.

result.title: Periodic Digital Dissemination Activities Report v1
result.description: The foreseen webbased communication channels according to the dissemination plan from T81 will be active during the whole projects lifetime reporting any advances within a dedicated report at a periodic consolidated basis while being populated and supported by the visual and multimedia material developed in T82 A coherent and aggressive dissemination strategy will be designed for the web and social networks see T81 accompanied by the high outreach potential given by the social media platforms presence such as LinkedIn Facebook Twitter YouTube issued early in the project while maintained and evaluated periodically until its completion Moreover project newsletters and webpress releases with news and info project activities events and available outcomes
